ul.li1: 1“Sing for joy, barren woman; who has not borne!
ul.li2: Burst forth into rejoicing and rejoice, she who has not been in labor!
ul.li3: For the children of the desolate woman are more than the children of the married woman,” says Yahweh.
ul.li1: 2“Enlarge the site of your tent,
ul.li2: and let them stretch out the tent curtains of your dwelling place.
ul.li1: You must not spare; make your tent cords long
ul.li2: and strengthen your pegs,
ul.li3: 3for you will spread out to the right and to the left.
ul.li1: And your descendantsHebrew “descendant” will be heir to the nations,
ul.li2: and they will inhabit desolate towns.
ul.li1: 4You must not fear, for you will not be ashamed,
ul.li2: and you must not be confounded, for you will not feel abashed,
ul.li1: for you will forget the shame of your youth,
ul.li2: and you will no longer remember the disgrace of your widowhood.
ul.li1: 5For your husbandThe Hebrew is plural is your maker,The Hebrew is plural his name is Yahweh of hosts;
ul.li2: and your redeemer is the holy one of Israel, he is called the God of all of the earth.
ul.li1: 6For Yahweh has called you like a wife forsaken and hurt of spirit,
ul.li2: likeOr “and” the wife of childhood when she is rejected, says your God.
ul.li1: 7I abandoned you for a shortLiterally “in a small” moment,
ul.li2: butOr “and” I will gather you with great compassion.
ul.li1: 8I hid my face from you for a moment, in the flowing of anger,
ul.li2: butOr “and” I will have compassion on you with everlasting faithfulness” says your redeemer, Yahweh.
ul.li1: 9“For this is like the waters of Noah to me,
ul.li2: when I swore that the waters of Noah would never again passLiterally “from the passing over of the waters of Noah again” over the earth,
so I swore that I would not beLiterally “from being “ angry at you and rebuke you.
ul.li1: 10For the mountains may depart,
ul.li2: and the hills may sway,
ul.li1: butOr “and” my faithfulness shall not depart from you,
ul.li2: and my covenant of peace shall not sway,”
ul.li1: says Yahweh, who has compassion on you,
ul.li2: 11“O afflicted one, driven away, who is not consoled.
ul.li1: Look! I am about to set your stones in hard mortar,
ul.li2: and I will lay your foundation with sapphires.
ul.li1: 12And I will makeLiterally “place” your battlements of ruby,
ul.li2: and your gates of stones of beryl,
and all your wall of precious stones.
ul.li1: 13And all your children shall be pupils of Yahweh,
ul.li2: and the peace of your children shall be great.

ul.li1: Be far from oppression, for you shall not fear,
ul.li2: and from terror, for it shall not come near you.
ul.li1: 15If indeed one attacks, it is not from me;
ul.li2: whoever attacks you shall fall because of you.
ul.li1: 16Look! I myself have created the craftsman who blowsOr “blowing” the fire of coals,
ul.li2: and who producesOr “producing” a weapon for his work;
alsoOr “and” I myself have created the destroyer to destroy.
ul.li1: 17Every weapon formed against you shall not succeed,
ul.li2: and you shall declare guilty every tongue that rises against you for judgment.
ul.li1: This is the inheritance of the servants of Yahweh,
